title: Diagnoses of the State of Cancer Treatments
text:
As an early-cancer-detection researcher, I applaud Azra Raza’s critique of the therapy-centric approach to cancer management (“Cancer Is Still Beating Us: We Need a New Start,” Review, Oct. 5).

The benefits of early cancer detection are hardly a foregone conclusion. Statistics showing improved survival with early detection are skewed by lead-time bias: Starting the “survival clock” earlier in the disease course will overestimate survival rates without changing disease mortality. description: A rational approach to early cancer detection could include focusing on individuals who have the highest genetic predisposition to cancer or tumor types with the longest lead times to metastasis.
